description: Explore the worlds of science fiction and fantasy literature, movies, and TV shows

questions.question: Who wrote the first true science fiction novel?
questions.funFact: This person wrote 'Frankenstein' when she was just 18 years old!
questions.story: 'Frankenstein; or, The Modern Prometheus' was published in 1818 and is considered the first true science fiction novel. Mary Shelley wrote it as part of a ghost story competition with Lord Byron and her future husband Percy Shelley during a rainy summer in Switzerland.

questions.question: What is the best-selling fantasy series of all time?
options: A Song of Ice and Fire
questions.funFact: This series has sold over 500 million copies worldwide!
questions.story: J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series revolutionized both children's literature and fantasy publishing. The first book was rejected by 12 publishers before being accepted by Bloomsbury, whose chairman gave the first chapter to his 8-year-old daughter to read. Her enthusiasm convinced him to publish the book.

questions.question: Which sci-fi author coined the term 'robotics'?
questions.funFact: He created the famous Three Laws of Robotics!
questions.story: Isaac Asimov first used the word 'robotics' in his 1941 short story 'Liar!' He also developed the Three Laws of Robotics, which have influenced real-world robotics development and discussions about AI ethics. These laws first appeared in his 1942 story 'Runaround'.

questions.question: Which robot grows plants?
questions.funFact: The design took decades to perfect!
questions.story: This advanced robot tends to alien plants in space stations, using quantum sensors to detect their needs and nanoscale tools to care for them.

questions.question: Which wizard paints reality?
questions.funFact: The brushes are made from starlight!
questions.story: This powerful wizard uses special brushes to literally paint changes into reality, altering the world around them with each careful brushstroke.

questions.question: Which ship sails dreams?
questions.story: This extraordinary spacecraft navigates through the collective dreams of sleeping civilizations, exploring the vast ocean of unconscious thought.

questions.question: Which alien knits galaxies?
questions.story: This ancient being creates new galaxies by knitting together dark matter and stellar material, using quantum threads to weave the fabric of space.

questions.question: Which dragon codes spells?
questions.story: This modern dragon writes magical spells using a special programming language, combining ancient sorcery with advanced computer science.

questions.question: Which city walks time?
questions.story: This entire metropolis physically moves through different time periods, its buildings and streets transforming as it steps between centuries.

questions.question: Which sword sings stories?
questions.story: This magical sword contains the memories of all its previous wielders, sharing their stories through musical notes when drawn from its scabbard.

questions.question: Which portal grows books?
questions.story: This mysterious portal generates new books based on the dreams and wishes of those who pass through it, creating unique stories for each traveler.

questions.question: Which spell cooks time?
questions.story: This unusual spell treats time like an ingredient, allowing the caster to 'cook' it into different forms and serve it to affect local temporal flow.

questions.question: Which robot dreams colors?
questions.story: This unique artificial intelligence experiences dreams as vivid colors, which it can project into the physical world as beautiful light displays.
